column5: If you could plan your perfect trip in NW Ontario during the summer months what would be your perfect weather preference? Are you highs in the 80s, low in the 60s with little rain or perhaps highs in the 60s, low in the 50s type of fisherman? Is there a certain outside temp where you feel fish are more active.
stable weather is my preference any time of the year. Good Luck!
A week in the 70's with slight breeze 60's at night and rain in the early morning (1-5am) clearing during the day and spectacular sunsets at night.A guy can only wish!
68 during the day with a south wind at 15 to 20 mph for 4days, 50's at night, throw in a few rainy days,Cigars ,beer and beer batter, it just does not get any better
Anytime we can get a south wind blowing at 15-20 mph for 4 or 5 days, catching is going to be very active.

Leave this Thurs for NW Ontario. We are on the water 6 1/2 days. The weather temps look fairly stable, with highs in the upper 60s and lows in the lower 50s. Two of the 6 1/2 days calls for 50% chance of rain or better. Theres always a ton of beer on this trip! I promise we don't struggle in that dept. I've been doing this trip a lot of years, and like most, a few weeks before our travels we all get dialed into checking weather forecasts daily.
It sound like your weather will be good,any time you can get on canadian waters is a good time,My friends on here ,Fishron & Retire 55 will atest to that. have a great time
